Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: CORE ID: Unique identifier for a well core
Column Comment.3: ANALYSIS OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique observation number assigned to theanalysis
Column Comment.4: SAMPLE NUMBER: A reference number assigned to this sample
Column Comment.5: SAMPLE ANALYSIS OBSERVATION NUMBER: identifying number is assignedusing the Obs No architectural principle.
Column Comment.6: SAMPLE DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: Number uniquely identifyingeach sample description observation.
Column Comment.7: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.8: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the base of the cored interval.
Column Comment.9: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.10: DESCRIPTION: A code representing the type of core show.
Column Comment.11: ANALYSIS SOURCE: The source that the analysis came from, this could be a labtechnician, a lab, a company, a government agency, etc.
Column Comment.12: DIP ANGLE: Angle of inclination of bedding planes measured in the core.
Column Comment.13: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.14: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.15: LITHOLOGY DESCRIPTION: Textual description of the core plug sample lithology.
Column Comment.16: POROSITY LENGTH: Total length of the cored interval analyzed for porosity.
Column Comment.17: POROSITY LENGTH OUOM: Porosity length original unit of measure.
Column Comment.18: POROSITY QUALITY: Standard quality indicators describing the porosity of thesample. For example poor, good, very good or excellent.
Column Comment.19: POROSITY TYPE: Type of porosity in the analyzed core sample (e.g., intergranular,sucrosic, or cavernous, etc.).
Column Comment.20: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.21: RECOVERED AMOUNT: Measured length of the core recovered.
Column Comment.22: RECOVERY AMOUNT OUOM: Recovered core amount original unit of measure.
Column Comment.23: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.24: CORE SAMPLE TYPE: This reference table identifies the type of core sample. Thecore sample may be a full diameter (whole core) or a plug sample (button, plug,cutting).
Column Comment.25: SHOW LENGTH: That portion of the core interval, expressed as a length, exhibitingthe reported SHOW QUALITY and SHOW TYPE.
Column Comment.26: SHOW LENGTH OUOM: Show length original unit of measure.
Column Comment.27: SHOW QUALITY: Standard quality indicators describing the hydrocarbon show in thesample. For example poor, good, very good or excellent.
Column Comment.28: SHOW TYPE: This column identifies the appearance of the hydrocarbons in theobject being evaluated. For example, show types can include Asphaltic stain,Bleeding gas, Oil fluorescence,...
Column Comment.29: STRATIGRAPHIC NAME SET NAME: a unique name of the the set of stratigrapahicnames to which the STRAT UNITS belong. A stratigraphic name set is a collection ofstratigraphic units, such as may be in use for a geographic area, a project,a companyetc.
Column Comment.30: STRAT UNIT ID: The identifier for the stratigraphic unit that is described in thesample.
Column Comment.31: SIDEWALL CORE RECOVERY TYPE: A code indicating the type of sidewall corerecovery. For example, R =Recovered, L = Lost or M = Misfired.
Column Comment.32: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the cored interval.
Column Comment.33: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.34: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.35: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.36: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.37: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.38: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.39: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.40: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
